Submodules¶

toolkit.config module¶

Configurations module.

toolkit.utils module¶

Module containing utilities for processing data from NVD feed.

class toolkit.utils.BooleanAction(option_strings, dest, nargs=0, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: argparse.Action

Argparse function to handle –flag and –no-flag arguments.

toolkit.utils.check_attributes(*attributes, allow_none=True)[source]¶

Check whether attribute_list contains valid elements.

Raises:TypeError
class toolkit.utils.classproperty(fget=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class property implementation.

Usage: Same as a @property decorator for instance properties, @classproperty can be used for class members.

TODO: solve the setter and deleter by adding a metaclass

toolkit.utils.clear(func)[source]¶

Decorate with cleanup before function call.

toolkit.utils.find_(word, stream, ignore_case=True)[source]¶

Find the word in the stream.

Parameters:
  • word – str, word or pattern to be searched in stream
  • stream – str, stream to be searched in
  • ignore_case – whether to ignore the case
Returns:

the corresponding word (could be of different case

if ignore_case is specified) from the stream

toolkit.utils.get_reference(cve, url=None, pattern=None) → Union[str, NoneType][source]¶

Return reference (if exists) based on {url, pattern}.

If multiple references are present, only the first encountered is returned.

Parameters:
  • cve – CVE object whose references attribute is an iterable of str references
  • url – str, if specified, requires exact match of cve reference with the given url

argument and takes precedence over pattern argument :param pattern: str, regex expression used for comparison, re.search() method is used

Returns:str, cve reference matching one of {url, pattern}
toolkit.utils.has_reference(cve, url=None, pattern=None) → bool[source]¶

Report reference existence based on {url, pattern} given.

Parameters:
  • cve – CVE object whose references attribute is of type Iterable[str]
  • url – str, if specified, requires exact match of cve reference

with the given url argument and takes precedence over pattern argument :param pattern: str, regex expression used for comparison, re.search() method is used

Returns:bool, whether cve references found in one of {url, pattern}
toolkit.utils.nvd_to_dataframe(cve_list: Iterable, handler=None)[source]¶

Create a pandas DataFrame from nvdlib.NVD object.

NOTE: This function requires pandas package to be installed (which is not a requirement for the standard installation or for production usage)

Parameters:
  • cve_list – list of nvdlib.model.CVE objects
  • handler – handler for cves, right now only GitHubHandler is supported
Returns:

pandas.DataFrame
